inn1.comm: good start, some away movement, sneaks past the edge
Taylor more secure here, getting up on his toes to defend
touch too short from Langeveldt and Taylor eases a pull down to deep square to get his innings moving
starts confidently, getting forward nicely and full-facing a defence to point
ooh, nervy poke outside off. Feet went nowhere but the hands followed the ball aimlessly
good over ends with a length ball bouncing nicely and forcing Chibhabha to hop to defend
Tsotsobe begins his ODI series in thoroughly unglamorous fashion, shoving a short ball down for a leg-side wide
much better this time, bending in a little, hint of extra bounce, beats Taylor's attempted leg-side nurdle
back of a length once more, but this time outside off stump and Taylor looks very strong in that region, defending crisply
this was a good delivery, dragging Taylor forward and finding an outside edge
Taylor attempts a pull shot but it looks a touch ungainly as he misses and it crashes into his belly
nicely timed off the front foot towards point where Duminy misfields and allows a single
calmly left alone outside off stump
a touch too short given the swing out there, Taylor defends easily
what's been good about Langeveldt  so far has been the lack of width on offer, nothing for Taylor to free his arms at
once again the line is nothing but very straight and Taylor defends watchfully
he looks a classy operator with shots like this, Taylor gets a fraction, nothing more than half a foot, of width and crisply punches a back-foot drive through extra cover for four
Langeveldt corrects his line immediately, honing into the off-stump channel. Defended
flash and a miss outside off, the batsman will feel he's missed out, the bowler will feel unlucky
good start to a new Tsotsobe over, swinging in on a full length and forcing a careful defence
glorious, quite expansive leave by Chibhabha outside off, real flourish as he lifted his bat far out of trouble
still Chibhabha is on the dreaded zero, but his defence is calm
slower ball, with the fingers rolled over the top, Chibhabha defends
banged in very short, Chibhabha nods by way of ducking
good delivery here, classic left-armer delivery, pushed across the flat-footed right-hander, who pokes at it rather tamely
good over ends well, Tsotsobe finding in inside edge as Chibhabha tries to force through the off side
another leave, Taylor is too compact  to leave with the expanse Chibhabha does but the effect is much the same
Taylor staying low in his crease and looking very watchful and eager as he defends
top shot, so simple, Taylor gets deep into his crease and pulls a shortish ball from outside off through midwicket
he's very strong outside off stump and Langeveldt dishes up a shortish widish ball that is slapped to deep point
Langeveldt finally adjusts his length, going fuller to find some swing, but falls victim to cricket's oldest rule - the ball does not swing away from outside leg stump
Chibhabha's away! What relief. Nurdles one into space and scampers off

poor delivery, shoved down the leg side, Taylor works it away with all the timing you'd expect of a man in his form and collects another boundary. Good over that for the tourists, they really needed it
Tsotsobe delivers another slower ball, and then practices it as he walks back to his mark, in between Taylor missed a leg-side hoik that thudded off his body for one
good delivery here, angling across Taylor who fiddles at it needlessly

how did Taylor get away with this!? Oh deary me. Slower ball, Taylor tried to flick it into the leg side and got nothing much of it, it looped into the leg side, hanging for an age in the air before plonking down into space, deep square couldn't run in in time to take it. Big let off
ooh, another leading edge as Taylor tries to fiddle into the leg side, loose batting
beaten this time! What's got into Taylor!? Dreadful poke outside off
finally something approaching solidity as Taylor defends
Langeveldt is lucky to get away with this, speared down the leg side and flicks the thigh
much better - full, straight, blocked
touch slower, outside off stump, Taylor steers it to third man
Chibhabha crouches low to duck under a bouncer, which wasn't high enough for the umpires to call one for the over
good length, good line, good defence, good cricket

wow, that's one way to inject some life into an innings! Chibhabha  edges down the wicket, Langeveldt sees him coming and bangs it in short, the batsman responds by a straight-armed jab pull over midwicket for six! It was only his second scoring shot!
short ball which Taylor wheels away down to deep square
very correctly defended off the  front foot
nicely played, crisp flick through straightish midwicket
after his aberration a couple of overs ago, Taylor seems to have reverted to his compact type, defending nicely
bosh! Just a fraction of width and Taylor creamed it through cover
having taken the boundary the ball before Taylor feels happy to leave alone
good start, on a length and line and defended
once again it's quietly defended into space for a single
good delivery here, tight off-stump line, squirted to third man
no room to work with, just simple defence
thuds away off the pads into the leg side
good finish to a good over, bang on a length and line and Taylor has to defend
good line, probing around off stump and defended
slightly fuller from Tsotsobe and defended steadily again
much better from Chibhabha, earns a single by defending down the ground and scampering a quick single
having bowled three good balls Tsotsobe conspires to drag down a short one, Taylor latches on to it, pulling firmly to the midwicket rope
oops, pushed too far across the right-hander, barely hits the cut strip
the sort of shot that makes commentators coo and batsmen smirk smugly - late dab towards third man - but it's only for one, I don't get the fuss
having seen his parter just do it, Chibhabha wants to join in the late-cut fun, and does so effectively enough to pick up the single
Zimbabwe bring up their 50 with Chibhabha working into the leg side
strangled shout as Parnell finds bat a pad with a full ball
ooh, too close to cut but Chibhabha tried to anyway, cramped for room and missed it
Parnell's first bad delivery, dragged down short and wide down the leg side
buzzers! Chibhabha works a fullish ball to mid-on, scampers through for a single but the throw came in, clipped the stumps and ricochetted away for overthrows
another poor ball, dragged down the leg side again
good comeback, straighter ball finds an inside edge and squirts for a single into the leg side
good finish to the over, old-fashioned hit-the-top-of-off stuff
who starts very well indeed, on and around off stump, defended with soft hands by Taylor's feet and a single scampered
Chibhabha uses the hint of width to steer to deep point
very good fielding from Miller at midwicket, diving nicely to his right, saves a couple from Taylor's leg-side clip

Theron strikes! Good change from Smith and it's the big wicket! Taylor defeated by a change of pace - he tried to hoik into the leg side but only managed a top edge that sailed behind him down to de Villiers who pouched it easily. Big breakthrough
worked into the leg side, "two" is the call from the batsman but one is the reality
gone first ball! Theron has two! Pushed across the left-hander, Williams poked at it with no foot movement at all and got a faint edge behind. What an over!
Parnell keeps the pressure up with full, straight ball that Chibhabha defends
more width on offer here but Chibhabha can't time his cut
good delivery once more, back of a length, rising around off stump, Chibhabha can only defend
bouncer this time, not rapid but Parnell has certainly found some rhythm, Chibhabha ducks low to avoid
shortish ball again, this time Chibhabha drops his hands by way of leaving
Parnell strikes this time! Zimbabwe tottering now! Trying to run this down to third man but the touch of extra bounce and pace did for him and a de Villiers snaffles the faint edge
good start to Theron's new over, straight and Taibu defends
Flower blocks his first ball very crisply
defended again quietly
Theron is forever angling the ball in and Flower uses the angle to nudge into the leg side
the old man is very swift indeed between the sticks, Taibu drops one by his feet and Flower is rocketing through for the single
slower ball to finish the over, Flower forward to defend
Parnell angles one across Taibu who steers a single down to third man
just back of a length and Flower nudges a quick single into the off side
lovely shot, Taibu is the classic busy-looking wicketkeeper-batsman, gets some width here and in a flash of arms, wrists and bat sends this racing through to the point boundary
and again! Top shot to a bad ball, crashing a cut shot for four
Parnell gets his line right this time and Taibu misses a leg-side flick
touch of extra bounce, Taibu rises with it and with a flick of the wrists sends the ball down to third man for a single
short ball to start the over, Taibu sways out the way
Theron has no great pace but has kept a very tight line indeed, nothing for the batsmen to pick off
Taibu wanders across to the off side and dabs into leg, calling Flower through for another swift single
slower ball finds Flower's inside edge, trickles away for a single
ooh, play and a miss outside off, this holds its line and Taibu fences quite aimlessly at it
worked behind square on the leg side for a strike-stealing single
starts well, around off stump and pushed to cover
Flower down the wicket and driving a single to long-off
Taibu tries to work a single into the leg side but can't
touch of spin here, defeats Taibu as he tries to work to leg
some width that Taibu uses to crack to deep point
good finish to the over as Taibu defends back to the bowler
Theron angles one into the hips and Flower works to deep midwicket for a couple
this is again on the legs and Flower again works it away into the leg side for a single
shot! That's probably the first shot he's timed in international cricket for about six years, shoved down the leg side by Theron and clipped very firmly through midwicket
defended with soft hands into the off side and Flower races off for one
defended quietly into the off side
Taibu pokes a defence into the off side and screams "NO!" as he sees Flower tearing up the other end
lovely shot, skipping down the wicket and driving with the straightest of bats past the bowler
Taibu eases a drive through the covers and scampers two
nicely driven again into the off side for a single
played with soft hands towards cover for another quick single
quicker ball is dropped a touch shorter and Taibu is back and pulling in a flash, without much timing for a single
Flower completes an fine exhibition of middle-over milking but dabbing a single to midwicket
slower ball from Parnell to begin a new spell, Flower looks in good order today and works a single to deep square
another slower ball and Taibu tries to work a single but finds the fielder
good line here, good length too, heading for off stump until Taibu defends
back of a length this time, Taibu will be disappointed not to have beaten point with his cut shot
fuller ball that's driven crisply past a diving cover for a single
back of a length and defended calmly
flighted on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
driven down to long-on for a single, the 100 is up
quicker, flatter, coming into Flower, who guides it to short third off the back foot
skips down the track and drives, but straight to extra cover
this time Peterson strays onto the pads, and is worked away square for one
full delivery, nice flight there, driven crisply to extra cover
fullish delivery on the legs from round the stumps, Flower comes down the track, missed the ball, is hit on the pads, a needless overthrow concedes two
full on the legs, worked away through midwicket, the man from deep square leg runs across and puts in the dive, but can't stop it, a bit of sloppy work there
and he is gone! it was flighted on the middle stump, he again skipped down the track, was completely beaten in flight, and turned to hear the death rattle behind him, JP strikes
nicely flighted on middle again, defended off the front foot
beaten outside off, this one was shorter in length
driven down to long-off to end a successful over
driven down to long-on
driven down to long-on again for another single
fullish delivery on the stumps again, turns this one away through midwicket
comes forward and turns it away through midwicket for a run, they need to more of this, rotating the strike that is
tries to work this one turning in on the leg side, is beaten and hit on the pads
he succeeds this time, flicked away through midwicket
floated up outside off, driven away to the man on the sweeper boundary
lovely flight from Duminy, a touch shorter in length outside off, Taibu taps and looks to run, but there isn't any
outside leg stump this time, swept away to fine leg
same line, similar length, but Taibu thinks this should be reverse-swept, and does so for a single
turned square for another single, nicely done
comes down the track and drives it to long-on to retain stike
defended off the front foot into the off side, Ervine wants one, Taibu shouts "No" and sends him back
driven to the sweeper, and this time Taibu will take the single
turned to square leg for another single
inviting the drive outside off, Taibu obliges, but finds extra cover
quicker and flatter on the stumps, he plays it off the back foot through the covers for a run
on the pads, flicked fine for one more
long-on is in business again, as this one is driven down to him
short, turning in a shade, Taibu rocks back and pulls it to deep square
nicely done by Ervine, drives it wide of long-off, and swift running gives them two
bowls it quicker this time, he drives to extra cover, "nicely bowled," chimes AB
going down the leg side, and called a wide, AB had the stumps off in a flash, but Ervine is safe
what a delivery from Duminy! flighted on off, turning away and beating the outside edge
cut away this time for a single
flighted outside off, carefully defended off the front foot
comes down the pitch, and turns it square but the fielder is close in and they give up all thoughts of a run
swept away to deep fine leg for a couple
fuller this time, driven down to long-on, that man has been busy today
nicely bowled, cramping Taibu for room, he can only push it back to the bowler
turned away behind square for a single
strays down the leg side, it is helped on its way to fine leg for a single
he strays onto the pads of the left-hander this time, and is flicked away to fine leg
Duminy is persisting with this line outside leg, worked away behind square
and just as I say this, he bowls one that pitches on off, and turns away to beat the attempted drive
pushed to cover for a quick single, it would have been close if Smith had hit
Taibu skips down the track and drives it wide of long-on
played towards midwicket, Peterson hares across and keep them to one
full delivery on middle, he paddles it down to fine leg
gets too close to the pitch of this one outside off as he skips down the track, and drives it back to the bowler
slower this time, no room to work with, he can only defend it
worked away through square leg for a single
driven through extra cover for a single, they contemplate another, but wisely decide against it as the throw comes in
starts with one short and wide outside off, but Taibu cuts it straight to point
better line this time, good length on middle, Taibu gets across and works it to midwicket
bangs it in short, effort ball, Ervine ducks calmly
shortish ball angling away from Ervine, but he can't beat backward point with the glide
and again, this time he gets it to the right of the man at backward point, who dives and prevents the single, good effort
cannot beat point this time
cut to to deep point firmly
this slips down the leg side
nicely worked from around off stump into the square leg region
Taibu tries to force though cover but skews an inside edge down to mid-on
defended with a minimum of fuss
tickled round the corner for a well-run single
touch shorter, Taibu tries to cut but can't time it
calmly turned away to backwards square for a single, not a lot more available for Zimbabwe at this stage
good running gets Taibu a single here, pushed to cover and off straight away
play and a miss outside off. No real reason for it, perhaps it kept a touch low. 61 deliveries without a boundary
as if on cue, Ervine duly delivers a boundary! Langeveldt drops short and it was pulled very firmly to the midwicket rope

gone this time! Ervine tries to repeat the shot but Langeveldt, the canny old fellow he is, held it back a fraction, delivering a slower-ball bouncer, Ervine through the shot too early and top-edged straight to mid-on
gets a bouncer first up with he tucks under
defended into the off side
languid drive but only as far as long-off
pushed firmly to short cover
this time the drive is straighter and is rewarded with a single
nothing on offer here as Peterson slings it in a touch straighter
worked back to the bowler who fields with a tumble before excitedly picking himself up and throwing back to the keeper
starts on a length and line, finds the inside-half of the bat and it runs away for a single
defended quietly into the off side
they've done well to take two here, pushed towards deepish point and a lung-busting effort to get back
lovely shot, Taibu is fell of ability, reads a slower ball here and slaps straight over the bowler's head for four
50 for Taibu and gets there in style! Crashes a shortish ball through straightish cover with a flick of the wrists, he's played really well this innings after rightly being pushed up the order
width again from the bowler, worked into the off side for another single
tickled into the leg side
driven firmly but straight to cover
this time the drive beats cover and earns a couple
good shot this, very straight bat flowing through the ball to send it down to long-off
nudged back to the bowler quietly
just a hint of width allows Taibu to flash his arms through the ball, take a single, and close a decent spell from Peterson. Nothing magic but accurate enough on international comeback
flash and a miss outside off, the ball was there for it - short and wide, but Taibu missed it
Tsotsobe switches to around the wicket and angles this into Taibu who defends
gently stroked with no timing at all to cover for a single
banged in short, too short for the umpire's liking
fuller this time and driven straight to mid-off who is deep enough to allow a single
good delivery here, finds some extra bounce, Taibu rises with it and dabs to point
poked down to third man to finish the over
starts with a widish one that is cracked through cover for a single
pushed with soft hands into the off side for another strike-turner
Taibu misses an attempted pull and then wants a single after it thuds into his body, is sent back by his parter
shot! Good thing he was sent back the previous ball. Taibu picks a slower ball and whips it over long-on for six!
defended carefully by his feet, wants a single but can't have it
inside edge squirts to leg to get a single
calmly defended
pushed gently into the overs and some swift running earns a single
this is shoved down the leg side and whipped flamboyantly, with a whirl of the wrists to the deep square boundary, where despite a diving effort, Theron can't prevent four
better ball this time and Chigumbura defends
shortish and straightish and Chigumbura is up on his toes to defend
flicked airily down to deep square but it arrives on the bounce to the fielder
Theron starts a new over well, angling it in as always, dropped towards point and a scampered single
ooh, play and a miss outside off
and again! Touch of reverse perhaps? Just drifts away late and past Taibu's outside edge
enough width here for Taibu to steer to third man securely
Theron strikes again! Just when Zimbabwe were building a stand. Chigumbura gets some width but it's a slower ball which finds an inside edge that goes onto the stumps
ooh beaten first ball! Good delivery too, bounce and bit of zip, climbing past the outside edge
good line to start the over, Taibu can do nothing but defend
poked towards cover point where Duminy swooped an almost pulled off an excellent run out, he's been a livewire at point
nicely played by Dabengwa, getting over to the offside and flicking to leg
oops, ugly delivery, shoved well down leg
Zimbabwe's 200 is up with a neat cover drive, but they'll need a big final 10 overs
guided down to third man again to rotate the strike
Tsotsobe seems to be in a bit of trouble here, grabbing the tendon by his knee rather uncomfortably, or maybe he's annoyed that this was so casually worked into the leg side for a single
slower ball to start with, wheeled away behind square for a single
banged in short and pulled very firmly to deep square
nicely done here from Dabengwa, dropping to cover point and scampering one
Taibu rises with this shortish ball and guides down towards deep point
bouncer which Dabengwa wants nothing to do with, swaying out the way
short ball again, not a great over this, pulled away to keep the strike
starts with a good one, outside off that slips past Dabengwa's outside edge
shot! In the slot from the bowler and Dabengwa stands still before easing his arms through the ball and sending it handsomely over the bowler's head for four
guided away fine to third man where Parnell skirts round and fields sharply to keep it to one
Taibu can only defend this
juicy full toss dished up but Taibu gets too much of a leg-side tickle, wanted it finer than he got it so only a couple
frenetic two here, Taibu dropped it to point, who ran in, swooped and failed to gather, Taibu had the single done in a flash and scampered back for a second
woah! Where was Dabengwa in the first game!? This is massive! Slower ball from Parnell right into the hitting arc and it was heaved over midwicket
this time he defends a better ball, Parnell started the day well but has fallen away, sign of someone not quite at their best on the way back from injury
good delivery here, touch more menace in it, moving away a fraction off the pitch past the outside edge
bouncer this time that Dabengwa ducks under it
and again! This wasn't quite as well timed but six more! Call on the Powerplay Dabengwa's in charge now! Short ball, poor ball really, but it was heaved over square leg
follows a boundary with a very correct forward block

oh dear. Taibu's gone! Or has he? Simple enough outside edge, went low to Theron at short third man who claimed the catch. The South African's were celebrating by Taibu hangs around. Eventually he's sent on his way and it ends an excellent innings.
excellent delivery to Utseya first up, full and straight at defended
expansive drive but it picks out short cover
this is an excellent over so far, nothing for Utseya to work with
could we have a wicket maiden to greet the Powerplay!? Bouncer here that Utseya sways out the way of
single taken to finish the over, so no maiden, but very very good
slower ball, stabbed rather ungracefully into the covers
nothing on offer here, quietly defended
good full length, not much room for Dabengwa  to get any leverage and can only bunt a single
shortish ball that Utseya tries to smash away, only gets a top edge that sails down towards fine leg on the bounce, a swifter fielding effort could have made a chance of that
shot! Excellent work from Dabengwa, clear-headed clean hitting, leg plonked down, big arms swing through the line to send it down to the deep square boundary
ooh, beaten outside off stump. Better length, much fuller, and an attempted flash was missed. Dabengwa is the key here
shot! Attempted yorker missed and crashed back down the ground for four
two this time, worked into the leg side
just a single here, thudded off the pads
fuller delivery outside off, Dabengwa drags it and works it to mid on
Utseya pulls it to Duminy at deep square, he takes it on one bounce
shoved very wide of off stump
swing and a miss outside off stump
fired in full on leg stump, he had an almighty swipe at it, and it went over square leg for four
and again Rusty fires this on leg, this time there is no connection though there is an attempted swipe, and the ball rolls off the pads for a leg bye towards covers

lovely, lovely slower one from Theron, cut away from outside leg stump, Dabengwa tried to work it on the on side, the bat face closed early, and the top edge balloons to the left of de Villiers who accepts his fourth catch of the innings gleefully
Theron with the full delivery on leg stump, goes off the pads towards fine leg
straighter and quicker this time on middle, he pushes it down to mid off and they take the single
yet another slower one, fuller this time, Utseya tries to go full blast over extra cover, not much timing on that shot and it falls between the two fielders at cover and extra cover
fullish ball on the legs, flicked through midwicket
a bit predictable with that full leg stump line, and Utseya gets down on one knee and scoops it over short fine for a boundary, cheeky
good comeback from Parnell, yorker length on the stumps, dug into the off side, South Africa have been liberal with the overthrows, and concede another one
gone this time! hits this one on leg straight to the man at square leg, he wanted to go much squarer, but it came of the inside half of the bat, end of a breezy little knock from Utseya
Parnell strays down too far down the leg side and its called a wide
another leg stump delivery, turned square for a single
Parnell is overdoing this leg stump line, strays down the pads for a wide again
better line on off stump and fuller this time, driven to the right of mid off, who puts in the dive but the ball slides past him and they have enough time to take a couple
full on middle, he is struck on the pads, Theron appeals for the leg before but the umpire doesn't think its out

there's no need for the appeal this time, as another beautifully bowled slower one cleans up Cremer, it was short of a good length outside off and came back in ... ever so slowly ... to go past his cross-batted swipe and hit the top of off stump, and thats a fifer for Rusty, in only his second ODI, well done

inn2.comm: flighted slowly through the air, turning in to Amla who waits for for it and turns it towards midwicket and is off with a single
turning away from Smith outside off, cut away to point
straight on the stumps, defended back to Utseya
floated up on the off stump line, Smith comes down the track and pushes it back down the track
ooh, almost did him in the flight there, Smith was again skipping down the track and was looking to heave it over mid-on, is beaten in the air and it falls short of the man there
cut away in front of point, but that area is thick with fielders and one of them tidies up, good first over that
short of a good length, climbing a bit on off stump, Amla defends with a straight bat
quicker this time, angling into Amla from short of a good length, he is beaten for pace and it goes off the pads towards the covers, and they go across for the leg bye
short, wide, and angling away from Smith who lets it go
angling away from short of a good length, closer to the stumps this time, Smith steers it to third man
slower one outside off, Amla waits on it and adjusts late to slap it away to third man
full outside off and angling away, Smith gets right to the pitch of it and drives it through extra cover but a single is all he manages as there's a sweeper on the boundary
Amla stands tall and smashes this good length delivery outside off through point, third man run s hard and puts in the dive but palms it away over the ropes
too close for the cut, Smith attempts the shot nevertheless, and under edges it close to the stumps
the third umpire has been called in as Amla was a bit lazy to get in the crease as they ran for a quick single, but no harm done as he makes it in time
played back to Utseya, this is good bowling
he beats Amla in flight this time, as he skips down the track looking to clear mid-off but clears cover instead with the top edge
fuller this time outside off, quicker too, Amla remains on the back foot and pings mid off with the drive
turned away square for a single

Amla was standing almost a foot outside off even before the ball had been bowled, Masakadza tried to cramp him for room, but he uses those lovely wrists to flick it for a boundary through square leg, what a shot
tries to work this one through midwicket but mistimes it back to the bowler
short on off stump, Amla is quick to pull it, but there's a man on the deep midwicket boundary
short of a length outside off, Smith misses with the cut
angled across Smith, who again finds air outside off, this time with the attempted drive on the up
short of a good length and climbing into Smith, who works it away to midwicket
full delivery on off, driven back to the bowler
slower and flighted outside off, Amla waits for it and turns it square for a single
short and turning away outside off, Smith gets the cut right in the gap through point and cover for a boundary, this outfield is quick
shimmies down the pitch and drives down towards mid on
this time Amla drives to mid on for a single,
nicely flighted outside off and turning away, too full to cut, and Smith duly misses the shot
Amla's eyes lit up as he saw this full delivery on the legs, and flicked it through mid wicket all along the ground for four

better line outside off, short of a good length, Amla just stands in the crease and punches it through extra cover, the fielder chases it and ends up chasing it all the way to the boundary, that just looked a push
slower one outside off, Amla waits for it to arrive and calmly guides it to third man
Smith is going nowhere with his attempted drives through the off side, he misses this one angled across him again
this time he connects with the front foot drive, but Utseya at backward point denies him a boundary with a fine diving stop
short and wide, Smith cuts it away to the sweeper for a single
strays on the pads, Smith's flick finds short fine leg
quicker and straight on the stumps, Smith gets his bat down in time and pushes it back to the bowler
this time its slower through the air, comes even more slowly off the pitch, turned through midwicket
Amla walks across his stumps, but works it straight to short fine leg
driven to extra cover off the back foot
driven wide of mid on for a single
a rare swing and a miss outside off from Amla
pushes to mid on and sets off for the single, direct hit but he's home
slow full toss outside off, Smith picks it up and drives to the left of the sweeper for a comfortable couple
yet another slow looping full toss, Smith is surprised a bit and plays it back to Masakadza
short of a good length on leg stump, Smith likes it there and works it away instantly through mid wicket for a single
angling into Amla from short of a good length, he plays it through mid wicket as well for another tun
good length outside off, driven to point
Amla is lucky here, is taken by surprise by the short one and top-edges the pull over square leg  but it falls safely
what a shot from Smith, down the track and lifts this length delivery over the bowler's head, as clean a hit as you'll ever see, or read about
imperious from Graeme, smashes this fullish delivery straight down the ground for another boundary
short and wide outside off, creamed through the covers for a single, that was crisply hit
Amla into the act now, Chigumbura serves it up on the pads, and he flicks it to the left of short fine for the third four of the over
Smith has suddenly started to connect everything as he slams this full ball high and over mid on for a six
and again, drives this ball outside off, and even as one hand comes off the bat handle, there is enough power on the shot to make the sweeper put in a dive and somehow manage to prevent the boundary
short outside off, half-tracker really, Smith pulls it handsomely through midwicket for four, Zimbabwe are falling apart here
goes for the pull again, it doesn't come off cleanly this time and rolls away to midwicket
fuller on off, Smith doesn't get the timing on the drive as again his hand comes off the bat handle
and as suddenly as he had gained his timing, he has lost it, as he mistimes another drive to mid off
Amla tries to slap this length ball through the covers, but extra cover dives and saves a certain boundary
one run, full and straight, attempted flick to mid-wicket, misses but gets one off the pads anyway
full and straight again, driven to mid-off for another easy single
one run, short and widish, worked down to third man for a walkable single
right in the slot for Smith to heave the ball over mid-wicket for a one-bounce four

Smith goes, backing right to leg before the ball had even be delivered. This one was just held back a touch by Chigumbura, Smith was through the shot too soon and a swirling top edge landed safely in Dabengwa's hands at mid-off
full and straight, forward defence
short of a length, straightish, worked down to third man with an open blade
shortish straight delivery, pulled away to deep square for a single
short of a length, just outside off, Amla opens the blade and works the ball down to third man for another single
the ball was tapped towards Ervine at mid-off, they set off for a sharp single. They shy was on, but the back-up wasn't in place and the ball speeds to the fine leg boundary
flicked to square leg off the backfoot
another quick single taken to backward point
driven through cover to the offside sweeper
driven through cover once more, that takes Amla to another half-century
flicked to short 45 on the leg side, Amla sets off for the quick single
short and straight, pulled away to deep square leg
imperious pull from de Villiers! Chibhabha really doesn't have the pace to bowl short, and this is put away with ease to the midwicket boundary
cut out to deep extra cover off the backfoot
slower ball, right in the blockhole, kept out well by Amla
worked down to third man once more
full-toss, driven straight to cover, should've made more of that and de Villiers is quite annoyed with himself
welcome to the game, Cremer. De Villiers wastes no time, taking a couple of steps down the track and lifting the ball flamboyantly onto the grass bank at wide long-on
one run, driven down to long-on for a single
flicked to square leg, right off the legs, just straying a bit too straight
shortish outside off, cut away powerfully to deep extra cover
driven down to long-off for an easy single
flicked straight to midwicket
shortish and straight, worked down to long-on this time for another easy single
driven out straight to deep extra cover
Zimbabwe are starting to flag noticeably now. Dabengwa dragged this halfway down and de Villiers aimed a thundering pull to midwicket. The field barely moved
four more, and that takes the partnership to 50. Wrong length from Cremer this time, but it was a sloppy attempt to stop the ball on the boundary that let this through for four
width outside off, and Amla's not going to miss out on that. Slapped away through backward point
stroked out very easily to deep cover
Amla attempts a sweep, doesn't get very  much of it and it trickles away
this time he gets a single, pushed into the leg side
no fuss for de Villiers, simply stroking to deep cover
this turns quite a long way, but Amla is seeing footballs and has no problem working this round the corner
bang! de Villiers is in complete control, skipping down the wicket and nailing a straight drive, massive "thud" as it crashes into the boundary board
this is bigger, it's maximum! Down the wicket again and crashed over long-on
follows the boundary with a leg-side work for a couple more
touch shorter from the bowler here, de Villiers up on his toes and punching down the ground
Amla languidly works square of the wicket
whipped away to straight long-on for a strike-stealing single
the bowler is lucky to get away with this, shortish ball thumped straight to deep midwicket
flicked to short midwicket who dives nicely to field
lovely inside-out cover drive from Amla, all wrists and talent and class
de Villiers eases a single through cover to bring up a swift 50 from 37 balls
with a flick of the wrists, Amla has worked this into the leg side
de Villiers lets the ball run off the face and dribble square of the wicket for a single
carefully defended into space for a single
Amla strokes towards cover point but can't get a single
pushed straight to extra cover
blocked again
more expansive from Amla this time, flashing a drive through extra cover
carefully played back to the bowler
that's the 100-run stand, Amla going inside out and flashing a wonderfully-timed drive
flicked into the leg side
de Villiers turns his hands over the ball in defence
shoved down the leg side and swept on its way for a single to deep square
touch of extra spin here earns a rare false shot
cut straight to backward point
Flower angles this into the pads, carefully prodded away
eased square of the wicket on the off side for one
Amla forward and defending calmly
stroked down the ground to milk a single
pushed square of the wicket on the off side for one
classic middle-over flick to long-on for a single
Amla greets him by skipping down the wicket and flicking to long-on
worked away to midwicket
forward in defence
lovely shot, Cremer drops short and Amla, flicks a cut shot behind point powerfully for four, just two away from another hundred
big spin here for Cremer landing the ball into the rough from around the wicket, it surprised Amla
plenty of spin once again, Amla prods it suspiciously into the off side
de Villiers content to block for a single to point
Amla tries to force it back past the bowler but Flower collects
touch of bounce but Amla rides it and works to leg
full toss punished! Gentle delivery but savage shot as de Villiers skips down the wicket and deposits this over the rope at cow-corner
single this time pushed down the ground
still Amla must wait! Drives back to the bowler to stay on 99
nicely bowled, good length and line and pushed into the midwicket region
there it is! Back-to-back hundreds! Amla flicks with a flourish into leg, jogs his since to bring up a century off 97 balls
nicely bowled again, de Villiers has to defend after coming down the track
good, diving fielding from Flower at point saves runs
Cremer switches to around the wicket and Amla sweeps very powerfully for four
oh dear, too short, sitting up and asking for trouble, Amla has all the time in the world to smash a boundary
milked down to long-on
touch too short, plenty of time to get back and chop to deep point
nice change of pace as Utseya sees de Villiers coming, forces a defence
driven back firmly past the bowler for a single
cut away to deep cover, Amla looking at total ease
very firmly struck but some diving fielding at short cover prevents runs
ooh dear, that's one way to avoid being hit for four, sling down a wide a long way past the off stump
oh how has Amla got away with this!? Short ball that he got a horrid toe-end top-edge that looped up just behind the bowler before plopping into space
gone this time though! Flicked powerfully straight to short midwicket. Ends another brilliant Amla knock
bouncer to greet the new batsman, who ducks
good slower ball, excellent, completely deceived Duminy as he tried to defend outside off
another attempted slower ball, bowled out the back of the hand - they are the toughest to control - and Masakadza didn't control it, instead it went a distance down the leg side
back of a length and carefully defended
driven down to long-on for a single
Duminy down the wicket and knocking this all along the ground to deep midwicket for a single
Utseya fires in a flat quicker ball that de Villiers inside edges down the ground
worked off the pads to square leg
touch shorter, de Villiers deep into his crease to cut but picks out cover
lovely shot, de Villiers got the width he wanted, but waited just a fraction longer than normal to pick a gap at deep backwards square
touch short and Duminy wheels a pull shot away
worked down the ground, wide of long-on for a couple
de Villiers gives himself room but Masakadza lands a yorker so he has to reach to bunt into the off side
full again and Duminy blocks
steered away to deep point
good over in the end, Masakadza lands another yorker which is stabbed to long-on
lovely shot again, short enough for de Villiers to hop back and crash through point for four
oh good shot again! de Villiers in a hurry! Skipping down the wicket and smacking this into the stands at long-on
pushed into the legs side quietly this time
stroked towards cover for one
Duminy is not nearly as fluent as yet and gets in a tangle as he comes down the wicket and has to defend
more secure from Duminy here, pushed down the wicket
worked round the corner, more inside edge than middle, but a single nevertheless
another full ball, straight too, he's bowled well this spell, comes off bat into pad behind the stumps for a single
not a great delivery this, bouncer down the leg side
Duminy gets away with this, mistiming an expansive drive in the air over mid-on for a couple
this time Duminy gets all of it, smashing a length ball through mid-on for a boundary
dropped! By the captain as well! Duminy drove crisply straight to Chigumbura, but he spilled the chance
sliced off the outside edge down to long-off, Duminy was aiming midwicket
starts well enough, blocked carefully into the leg side
de Villiers collects a couple whipping towards deep square
horrid ball, really dragged down and de Villiers didn't quite manage to punish it fully, swinging a pull down to deep square
drilled firmly back past the bowler to long-off
full toss, pretty gentle stuff from Taylor, must be stiff from his marathon effort in the opening ODI, knocked down to long-off

everyone knew what was going to happen, de Villiers was going to have a dart and he's sealed it in style, leaning back and smashing this into the stands behind the bowler's head. What a hundred! It only took 72 balls!
